intro: Moraea ciliata subsp. ciliata, commonly known as the ciliated moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and prefers well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are borne on tall, erect stems. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
